titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Smith Club of Hartford records CA.MS.00091
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kate Baker, Amanda Lineweber.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-12-03 14:35:35 -0500.

Updated to conform to DACS and added box info
Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.abstract: The Smith Club of Hartford was founded in 1896 as a means for former Smith College students, including non-graduates, to socialize. Its records contain minutes, membership directories, financial records, and correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series:

list.item: Series IV: General Files-Program and Alphabetical

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Smith Club of Hartford, Connecticut was founded in 1896 as a means for former Smith College students, including non-graduates, to socialize.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smith Club of Hartford, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00091, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of the Smith Club of Hartford span a century from 1896 to 2003 with the bulk of the records being from the 1980s and 1990s. The earliest, handwritten registers of minutes and membership from 1896 to 1920 describe the social nature of the club which continues to be a main feature of the Club. The Club's records detail the events, lectures, and fundraisers held since its start in 1896, especially how central fundraising for the Alumnae Fund has been. The correspondence sheds light on problems of attracting and keeping members, hosting profitable fundraisers, and involving young alumnae. Changes and updates in the Club's events schedule show how the Club attempts to deal with these challenges and gives the researcher a sense of the changing sensibility from socializing to networking for the Club as it entered the twenty-first century.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series covers the largest time-span of the Smith Club of Hartford records. The records begin with the founding of the club in 1896 through 1920. The minutes jump to the 1980s and continue through the late 1990s. The minutes by the Secretary cover Board meetings as well as General Body meetings and are fairly complete for the 1980s and 1990s. Copies of meeting announcements have been included with the minutes.

The membership files contain membership directories, recruitment mailings to Hartford area alumae, and member participation questionnaires. Most material in the membership files is concentrated between 1989 and 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The correspondence includes invitations to non-Club events, information and newsletters from the Smith Alumnae Association, and letters between members regarding Club events. Like the membership files, the correspondence files from the 1989-1992 program years contain the most information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The financial series includes Treasurer's records as well as information on the Club's fundraising events. Because fundraising for the Smith College Alumnae Fund is a high-priority for the Club, the Treasurer made periodic reports regarding the amount of the Club's bank account. The fundraising files include advertising and correspondence related to the Club's fundraising activities. Records about the Club's annual book sale and the beginning of its partnership with Hartford-based chef David Glass to sell chocolate mousse cakes are found in this series.

did.unittitle: Series IV: General Files: Program and Alphabetical

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The general files include material that was mailed to Club members and mailings announcing individual events. The rest of the Club's records are arranged in the alphabetical files. These alphabetical files contain records of specific, non-annual events and miscellaneous notes.

did.unittitle: Richard H. Hersh, Trinity College Inauguration
